Hi Tom, 

This is a great idea for an application of NEAT, but this thread =
is 
about CPPNs/HyperNEAT, a new kind of indirect encoding, not the 
origin=
al NEAT which is a direct encoding scheme. The dynamics of NEAT 
are still =
preserved though, but in this case you can consider the 
networks evolved a=
s a genotype of ..well, a genotype of something :) 
Please read the papers =
for an introduction to CPPNs. 

Peter

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "titan_=
ex3" <thomas.p.grant@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, all. My idea for using NEAT/rtNEAT=
 is for my honours project at
> uni where I, hopefully, will be using NEAT/=
rtNEAT in a game. One major
> idea I have had though is to possibly extend =
NEAT to control every
> aspect of a virtual organism, i.e. using the neuroe=
volution to create
> intelligent creatures, and extend the evolution to all=
ow a visual
> representation of each organism, where crossover and mutation=
 would
> effect the physical attributes of an organism. 
> Thanks 
> Tom.
